item.title: vim: The same vimrc on multiple computers
item.dc:creator: David García
item.description:
Reading this post I remember that I never commented here the way I (and a lot of people) use to share the same vimrc on different computers. Instead of doing it as that post says (which is not a great idea because an ‘ack’ may exists in OSX systems via port or homebrew) you can actually differentiate computers by…its name!…surprised?

Vim has a handy function called ‘hostname’. So, easy, just store it in a variable and let the music go:

let computername=hostname()

Now you can adapt your preferences between your computers. For example you can have a laptop with a little screen and a big iMac with a stunning 27 inch display. Obviously your columns and lines would not be the same.

How do you solve it? Come in, you are welcome to comment. I promise I won’t delete your contribution ;)

item.title: Two handy functions for turning on-off an 'IDE' in vim
item.dc:creator: David García
item.description:
Sometimes I found myself working on Vim as a simple editor, just to write a single file (tweaking a configuration file and similar stuff) but frequently I’m working on a project, these kind of project you’d use a complete IDE (put here Eclipse, NetBeans…).

Vim fills my needs in both sides so I worked two functions that make switching from side to side in a flick. Just put this in your vimrc and change key triggers as you want:

 1 nmap <leader>ide :call GetIDE()<CR>
 2 function! GetIDE()
 3     if !exists("*GetIDE")
 4         return
 5     endif
 6     NERDTree
 7     TagbarOpen
 8     set columns +=20
 9 endfunc
10 
11 nmap <leader>edi :call GetEDI()<CR>
12 function! GetEDI()
13     if !exists("*GetEDI")
14         return
15     endif
16     NERDTreeClose
17     TagbarClose
18     set columns -=20
19 endfunc

Just the idea is simple: leader+ide to get a full flavor IDE and leader+edi to return to an EDItor (pun wasn’t intended when named the function EDI = reverse(IDE);)

Code still needed a review and maybe an improvent but works right. Of course you’ll need NERDTree and Tagbar plugins but is easy to change these for your favorite plugin.

Hope it will be useful for you.
